imdb.title: Zombieland Saga
imdb.plot: A young singer dies and becomes a zombie. She is put in a musical group with other zombie singer girls as part of a campaign to save the world.

episodes.title: Good Morning Returns SAGA
episodes.plot: One month after Franchouchou's show at the Arpino, the group's success plummets when their performance at the Ekimae Fudosan Stadium disastrously bombs, leaving the group in massive debt. The girls spend the following months working at various jobs across Saga to cover expenses, while Koutarou abandons his efforts to save Saga and falls into a slump, despite the girls' repeated attempts to motivate him.

episodes.title: The SAGA of an Almost-Broken Radio
episodes.plot: Franchouchou makes a live televised appearance to promote the Yutoku Inari Shrine alongside White Ryu, an aging radio talk show host whom Saki admires.

episodes.title: The Acoustic SAGA of Love and Youth
episodes.plot: Koutarou schedules Franchouchou to perform at the new Saga Arena's inauguration as the opening act for Iron Frill, Ai's original idol group. He withholds Ai from the show to reduce the risk of her being recognized as a former member. Ai entrusts Junko with looking after the group while she focuses on a string of solo acts to help cover the group's debt. However, Junko harbors insecurities about repeating their previous failure, and struggles to advise the other girls as they brainstorm ways to impress the audience.

episodes.title: Pure-Hearted Electric SAGA
episodes.plot: Sakura and Junko agree to hide Ai's conversation with Shiori from the other girls, but Junko remains distracted by her own fears that Ai will accept Shiori's offer.

episodes.title: Little Bodda Bope SAGA
episodes.plot: Lily decides to mark Franchouchou's national television debut by competing in the reality talent show Japanese Got Performance.

episodes.title: Walking Bet SAGA
episodes.plot: Tae is sent to run errands while the rest of Franchouchou continues to work off their debt. Maria, who works at the supermarket where Tae arrives, invites her to watch Dorami perform at a dancing competition.

episodes.title: Mai Mai Revolution SAGA
episodes.plot: Maimai Yuzuriha, a fan of Franchouchou, seemingly dies when she blunders into the men's bath at the local public bathhouse and slips on a bar of soap dropped by Koutarou. Awakening after Koutarou brings her to the mansion to be resurrected, she is revealed to have simply been unconscious, and discovers the girls' undead status. Unfazed by her discovery and determined to emulate her idols' success, Maimai convinces Koutarou to let her join Franchouchou so she can help keep their secret.

episodes.title: The SAGA Incident: Part One
episodes.plot: In Meiji Era Japan, Yuugiri moves to the former location of Saga Castle, where its citizens idolize her but keep their distance due to her former occupation as a famous oiran. One day, she happens upon Kiichi Momozaki, a local young man who is determined to restore Saga's name following the prefecture's dissolution in the Meiji Restoration. Kiichi becomes smitten with Yuugiri and later visits her to offer a gift.

episodes.title: The SAGA Incident: Part Two
episodes.plot: The recruited samurai begin planning an attack on Nagasaki against Kiichi's wishes. Learning of the upcoming insurrection from an informant, Ito requests Yuugiri to leave Saga with Kiichi for their own safety; having anticipated this, Yuugiri sends letters to her acquaintances in Nagasaki to grant protection to Kiichi.

episodes.title: The SAGA of How These Zombies Will Get Their Revenge
episodes.plot: Three weeks after the Arpino concert, Koutarou announces his plans for the concert at the Ekimae Fudosan Stadium. Despite the girls' cautious optimism, the low attendance and the girls' anxiety lead to the show's failure. Their confidence is restored when Tae successfully purchases food with Koutarou's savings using poorly self-applied makeup, inspiring them to become more self-reliant and strive towards a "revenge" concert. The following year, Koutarou schedules the concert to occur at the stadium on the anniversary of the previous one, taking precautions to prevent ...

episodes.title: All It Takes Is for You to Be There SAGA
episodes.plot: Franchouchou's mansion drifts out to the shore of Hamasaki before collapsing, destroying their supplies and makeup. The girls are found by a co-worker from Ai's part-time job, who takes them to a makeshift shelter for those who lost their homes and power in the storm. They are found by Okoba, who secretly observes them as they perform for the local children.

episodes.title: The Greatest SAGA In History
episodes.plot: With Okoba's help, Koutarou convinces the governor of Saga to focus repair efforts around Tosu to enable public travel to Ekimae Fudosan Stadium, arguing that Franchouchou's charity concert will assist in unifying Saga. Meanwhile, Saki gathers Franchouchou to promote the concert over their radio show, encouraging anyone who hears it to attend.

episodes.title: Good Morning SAGA
episodes.plot: Minamoto Sakura is starting her second year of high school with a song in her heart and a head full of dreams. Can she really become a glittering idol on stage? Are her nights of living as a normal high school girl coming to an end?

episodes.title: I Love Hip Hop SAGA
episodes.plot: It's the dawn of a new life as Sakura meets the rest of her idol unit. But can they overcome their differences in personalities and come together to as a team?

episodes.title: DEAD OR LIVE SAGA
episodes.plot: On the day of their first guerrilla show, Sakura and the girls have barely had any time to rehearse, and Junko and Ai aren't sure about joining in. Will they be able to set aside their differences and capture the hearts of the passing pedestrians?

episodes.title: Warming Dead SAGA
episodes.plot: Franchouchou is headed to the land of Ureshino in Saga to do perform for a big company. Will they be able to win over a new business partner with their singing and dancing?

episodes.title: The Nice Bird SAGA in Your Heart
episodes.plot: After the trouble at the hot springs, the girls get an opportunity to promote a local legend. After they fail to chicken out, their next gig involves a train to Kashima to steal a muddy spotlight.

episodes.title: Because It's Sentimental SAGA
episodes.plot: Just when Franchouchou's efforts finally starting to attract some attention, a disagreement leads to Ai versus Junko in a battle of idol ideology.

episodes.title: But It's Zombiemental SAGA
episodes.plot: The time has come for Franchouchou to take the stage at the Saga Rock musical festival. But clouds are starting to gather, with the thunder and lightning causing Ai to freeze up in fear. Who will help re-animate her so that the show can be a success?

episodes.title: Go Go Neverland SAGA
episodes.plot: With Franchouchou gaining more notoriety from Saga Rock, the girls luck finally seems to be turning around. But they're in for a surprise: it's the return of the living dad when Lily's father spots her on TV.

episodes.title: Though My Life May Have Ended Once By Some Twist of Fate I have Risen, and If Song and Dance Are to Be My Fate, Then Carrying the Memories of My Comrades In My Heart As I Sally Forth Shall Be My SAGA
episodes.plot: It's been a long time since Saki used to fight an army of rival bikers in the darkness, but an unexpected encounter with the family of an old friend draws her into back into the kind of rough scene that could be anathema to her idol activities.

episodes.title: NO ZOMBIE NO IDOL SAGA
episodes.plot: The girls of Franchouchou are going to have a dedicated concert. With a crowd capacity of five hundred. And Koutarou's plan to get them ready is - training in the mountains? Will his braindead idea pay off?

episodes.title: A One-Of-A-Kind SAGA
episodes.plot: Sakura's amnesia is gone, and the results are unexpected. Will she be able to reconcile her new grim outlook on life in time for Franchouchou's big show, or is she doomed to be wasting away emotionally?

episodes.title: Good Morning Again SAGA
episodes.plot: The day of the Arpino show has come, and the other members of Franchouchou have made it clear to Sakura that they're not going to quarantine her because of her bad luck. But with a blizzard brewing, will the girls' undying loyalty to their friend prove to be their undoing?
